oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mass Protest Meeting
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Poster giving details of a mass protest meeting to be given in support of "Negro and white workers." The poster also serves as a petition for unemployment insurance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides; Protest posters; Political posters; Protest works; Protest movements; Employment; Unemployment; Communists
Broadsides; Communists; Communists--United States; Amter, I. (Israel), b. 1881
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Communist Party USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Communist Party of the United States of America (CPUSA) is a Marxist-Leninist political party. The Party's stated goal is to achieve a free, prosperous, and peaceful society free of racism, sexism, homophobia, and exploitation, in which all people have the opportunity to develop to their fullest potential. The speaker at the advertised meeting, Israel Amter (1881-1954), was a Marxist politician and a founding member of the Communist Party USA.
